description: A carbonated beverage that serves as Franky's power source. Franky calls it 'the water of life' as it fuels his cyborg body and maintains his combat abilities and aggressive personality.

keyMoments.title: Cola Powers Up Franky
keyMoments.description: After receiving wrong beverages multiple times, Franky finally gets three bottles of cola from Chopper and powers back up to full strength.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes cola as essential to Franky's character and combat effectiveness - it's literally his life force.

significance: Cola is fundamental to Franky's character design and abilities. It serves both as a power source for his cyborg body and as a recurring plot element and source of comedy.

reveals.information: Cola is the only beverage that properly fuels Franky's cyborg body - other beverages cause personality changes and combat weakness

description: A healthy beverage that, when consumed by Franky instead of cola, transforms him into 'Fresh Franky' with onion-shaped hair and a health-conscious personality, rendering him combat-ineffective.

keyMoments.title: Franky Becomes Fresh Franky
keyMoments.description: Chopper mistakenly gives Franky vegetable juice instead of cola, causing him to transform into a vegetable-themed persona with no combat power.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the comedic consequences of Franky using wrong fuel and establishes his beverage-dependent personality changes.

significance: Part of the comedic running gag about Franky's fuel requirements and personality changes.

description: A calming beverage that, when consumed by Franky, gives him wavy hair and a refined, peaceful personality, making him want to stop fighting and have tea instead.

keyMoments.title: Tea-Powered Franky
keyMoments.description: Chopper gives Franky tea instead of cola, causing him to adopt a calm demeanor and suggest having tea with his opponent rather than fighting.
keyMoments.significance: Further demonstrates the comedic beverage personality changes.

significance: Part of the running gag about Franky's beverage-dependent personalities.
